definition: polite term for old woman or man

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She replied that it is not possible because of their old teeth.
sentences.chinese: 阿婆回答，老人家牙齿不好，没办法吃。

sentences.english: I do not pretend to possess equal frankness with your ladyship.
sentences.chinese: 我并不冒充我也象你老人家一样坦白。

sentences.english: The garb was presented to Obama by elders in Wajir.
sentences.chinese: 这身装扮是瓦基的一位老人家送给奥巴马的。

sentences.english: But of course we immediately arranged to lead this old lady to receive Christ too.
sentences.chinese: 当然我们就马上安排带领这老人家信主。

sentences.english: The elderly and wish you good father as the Songjiang water, life than the old pine.
sentences.chinese: 并祝愿爸爸您老人家福如松江水，寿比不老松。

sentences.english: Here, I wish you longevity elderly family Rudong sea, pine.
sentences.chinese: 在此，我祝愿爸爸您老人家福如东海水，寿比南山松。

sentences.english: "The General," Wyatt threatens, "He likes his privacy.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特威胁道，“将军他老人家不喜欢被人打扰”。

sentences.english: She has been attacked by some lamas and is seriously hurt.
sentences.chinese: 她老人家身受重伤，后面还有七名喇嘛追来。

sentences.english: That old man is basking in the love of his family.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人家正享受着融融的天伦之乐。
老人家重未来式，年青人重现在式。

sentences.english: We presented the old man with a jade tortoise, wishing him a long life.
sentences.chinese: 我们给这个老人赠送了一只玉龟，祝他老人家长寿。

sentences.english: The grandfather absolutely wasted his poor old smile.
sentences.chinese: 外祖父他老人家可怜的微笑全属枉然。

sentences.english: The old man came down in the world and had to move to a small town.
sentences.chinese: 这个老人家道败落，只好搬到一个小镇上。

sentences.english: She moved in a month ago.
sentences.chinese: 老人家是上个月搬进来的。

sentences.english: That, old man's house, you know, what is what to work properly an inside oblation ?
sentences.chinese: 那，老人家，你知道，灵堂里供奉的是什么吗？

definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
